Reviews.Title: Basic phone for voice and texts use
Reviews.Author: Jojo M "xPlus Labs"
Reviews.Content: PROS: Sleek shape with smooth rounded corners, lightweigt (81.9g only). Matte back and side finish make exterior durable to scratches. LCD screen bright and easy to read. Navigation thru menu is easy - shortcut buttons and menu list can be customized. Alert sounds are solid, loud, non-irritating. Message alert repeat when text remains unread. Very long standby battery life. CONS: 4-direction navigation key is cramped, shiny front panel easily prone to scratch. No bluetooth although speakerphone function is enough for handsfree use. Price a bit expensive compared to more featured LG unit for nearly same cost. Overall, specs match up to expectations - just for basic calling and texting. A great gift for youngsters and adults who have not had a cellphone before, especially with the tight economy!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Socrates
Reviews.Content: Have had this phone since May 2008, (it's now Jan 2011) - I love this phone, I don't need anything more than basic phone use, and email,  works just fine,no problem at all with AT&T; and refilling, I only pay 2¢ for each call, I use it just to stay in touch, and to be rescued if I have a car problem.  It may not be available now from AT&T;, but there must be others.  It only cost me $15, and I am very happy with the phone and the service.  The charge lasts for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Good PHONE
Reviews.Author: E. Moseley "Papanomoe"
Reviews.Content: I use mine for a work phone. Its tough and I don't have to worry about my Iphone getting tore up.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: nellyrock
Reviews.Content: I brought the phone because my contracted phone through At&t; was old and a mess. For the price you can't beat it. I also did not have to sign up for a new contract, I just popped my SIM card from old phone into the new phone and was all set to go.

Reviews.Title: phone
Reviews.Author: Christine Velasco
Reviews.Content: awesome! absolutely love it! best purchase i have made. price was great for my budget. already recommended to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: purchase of Samsung sgh-137 that you requested a rating
Reviews.Author: Beverly Partlow
Reviews.Content: I was actually looking for a Samsung sgh-237, blue, and when this popped I didn't realize it was a totally different phone - no camera, no display on the outside of the phone, displaying who was calling, so I am disappointed with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: W. E. SNYDER
Reviews.Content: This phone is a replacement for my original phone which is now somewhere in the Atlantic Ocean. The phone has all the basic operations that I need (I'm 73 years old). The only problem that I have found with this phone is that there are several places that we have traveled to, where there is no network. Since I only use the phone occasionally this is not a problem for me but if you needed a phone in an emergency, in one of these areas, you would be out of luck.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, reliable phone
Reviews.Author: Juan A.
Reviews.Content: I had to get this as a temporary phone for a month. Was useful to have and while not a fancy smartphone, it gets the job done for the things that you need from a basic phone.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap
Reviews.Author: theknavery
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my wife (who sent hers through the washer machine) as an interim phone until see could get a better one at contract renewal.  Bought it through Amazon because I had some credit on my Gift Card account.  Reception is horrible. Sound quality sucks. And it seems to cut off all calls after about 5 minutes. Voicemail notifications show up 2 days later. Avoid this phone.

Reviews.Title: If you like wasting money, buy it
Reviews.Author: kwon234ioud
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because of a free $25 phone card that made this phone literally free. I added about $60 for $85. Even with casual uses, in a month the balance was near zero. I have no idea why. I think AT&T; charged for missed calls because I wasn't dialing any 900 numbers on it. Also for some reason I couldn't refill even though I tried three different times. I was eventually directed to customer service whose office was closed. I don't blame anyone, but this company does a good job turning money away. I needed this phone number for one more month, but they really make it hard to do business with them. Phone wasn't so bad overall. Clunky and plasticky. Go with T-Mobile if you are going for prepaid phones. Really regret not going with them in the first place.
